column4: Does anyone know how to specify to network manager which location to load at boot?
Do you mean like assign in /etc/network/interfaces which ESSID to associate with by default, or?
no; just need to get append an entry to the search path every time so that it searches my lab network which I'm never a 'member' of
Can't you add another line in /etc/resolv.conf for that?
no; because it gets overwritten everytime Network Manager does anything
Ah, got it.. in cases like that I tend to make a shell script to fix it for different locations. :)
I don't need it different for different locations; I need it always
it doesn't hurt me if it tries to search and can't find anything
I reckon you could do something with the interfaces ifup or post commands to run a script to append the search line after association.
so basically whether I get an address at X.com (office) or Y.com (home) or whatever else, I always want test.X.com searched... yeah I found a way to get it done for the vpn client easily enough
That sounds an awful lot like my situation.  I keep most of my servers at home and VPN into them when I'm out.  Still haven't nailed down resolving internal hostnames yet.
basically I'm at company X, and we have all of the test machines  that they use for "real activity" on their own subnet
so I'm never a member of that domain but I ssh into it constantly
I grok.  I've been fiddling with openvpn for a while now trying to get my VPN subnet to resolve hostnames on my internal LAN, much like your setup.
aliases could work but its not a good general solution
We have the at&t client thrusted down our throats
wasn't hard to fix that one :-)
Guh, tell me about it.  I just kludged that together to run on my Ubuntu 64 box the other day for work.
never had this problem before on any other distro version in the past 4-5 years
Wait, are you saying you managed to get a different VPN client working for you instead of the ATT one?  Because that would rock.
no I got the ATT one to work properly for me
want me to find the file I edited to get that setting to stay?
Yes please, feel free to PM me it.  I'm at work so may get lost otherwise.
